modules.description: Implements contact mechanics simulations with damped dynamics using matrix-based state representations. Provides `step` to compute a single time step evolution and `solve` to simulate the full trajectory over a specified time range. Designed for modeling physical systems involving constrained motion and damping forces.

Implements numerical integration for solving second-order ordinary differential equations with damping, operating on state vectors represented as pairs of matrices. It provides `step` and `solve` functions to compute the next state given a time step or evolve the system over a time specification. Useful for simulating physical systems like damped oscillators or mechanical systems with matrix-valued positions and velocities.

Implements damped contact dynamics simulations using matrix-based state representations. Provides `step` to compute a single time step update and `solve` to integrate over a time span, both operating on state pairs of matrices and vector fields. Designed for physical modeling tasks such as constrained mechanical systems with damping effects.

Implements numerical integration for a damped contact system using a provided evolution function. Operates on state tuples of two matrices representing position and velocity, advancing them through time steps or solving over a time specification. Useful for simulating mechanical systems with damping and contact forces.

This module provides numerical integration routines for simulating damped mechanical systems using matrix-based state representations. It includes submodules tailored for first-order and second-order differential equations, operating on matrix and vector field pairs to model constrained dynamics and oscillatory behavior. Concrete use cases include simulating damped oscillators and mechanical systems with matrix-valued positions and velocities.

This module provides numerical integration routines for simulating damped mechanical systems with contact forces. It operates on state representations consisting of pairs of dense matrices for position and velocity, evolving these states through time steps or over full trajectories. Concrete use cases include physics simulations involving constrained motion, such as mechanical systems with friction or impact interactions.

Implements damped contact dynamics for 1D and 2D systems using a custom array type. Provides `contact1_damped_s` and `contact2_damped_s` to simulate damped contact behavior with a given force function and time step. Designed for numerical simulations in physics or engineering contexts where contact forces are modeled with damping effects.

Implements numerical integration for damped mechanical systems with contact forces in 1D and 2D, using custom array types and matrix-based state representations. Provides functions to simulate damped oscillators and constrained motion with contact models, suitable for physics and engineering simulations involving friction or impact. Works directly on dense matrices and vectors to evolve system states over time steps or full trajectories.
